subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






April 24, 2007


                              		
                              		
                              	  Home | U.S. | World | Politics | SciTech | Health | Entertainment | Business | Opinion | Sports | Blogs | Interactives | Video



                              	
                              	  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation






TOP STORIES9 U.S. Troops Die In Attack On Iraq Base
Nine U.S. troops were killed and 20 more wounded when a suicide bomber attacked a forward patrol base in the deadly Diyala
                        province, north of Baghdad. Also, unknown gunmen in Iraqi army uniforms and vehicles have raided a village, killing six people. More...Watch: War Funding Deadlock Continues
• Toyota Is World's #1 Automaker• David Halberstam Killed In Bay Area Crash• Border Patrol Agent Charged With MurderU.S.David Halberstam Killed In Bay Area Crash
David Halberstam, a Pulitzer Prize-winning author who chronicled the Washington press corps, the Vietnam War generation and
                        baseball, was killed in a car crash early Monday, a coroner said. He was 73. More...
• Classes Resume At Virginia Tech
                     					| Watch• Execution Drugs Sometimes Fail To Work• Border Patrol Agent Charged With Murder• More StoriesWorldGetting Old In Cuba
Cubans enjoy one of the highest life expectancy rates in Latin America. But longer lives can create a strain for families
                        who have little recourse to nursing homes or assisted living facilities, writes Portia Siegelbaum in Havana. More...
• 9 U.S. Troops Die In Attack On Iraq Base
                     					| Watch• World Leaders Remember Yeltsin
                     					| Watch• Brits Arrest 6 On Terror Charges• More StoriesPoliticsReid: Bush In "Denial" On Iraq
Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid said President Bush is in "a state of denial" about the war in Iraq. Reid said the Democratic-controlled
                        Congress will pass a bill this week requiring U.S. troops to begin withdrawing from Iraq by Oct. 1. More...Watch: War Funding Deadlock Continues
• Poll: Little Change In Views On Handguns
                     					| Watch• Gonzales Vows To Stay On The Job
                     					| Watch• Execution Drugs Sometimes Fail To Work• More StoriesHealthNew Drug May Treat Muscular Dystrophy
An experimental drug called PTC124 may override a gene glitch seen in Duchenne muscular dystrophy, according to lab tests
                        done on mice. More...
• Is FDA Capable Of Keeping Food Safe?
                     					| Watch• U.S. Food Safety Strained By Imports• Medicare Trust Fund To Last A Year Longer• More StoriesSciTechNASA Captures 3D Images Of Sun
NASA has released the first three-dimensional images of the sun. The space agency says the photos taken from twin spacecraft
                        may lead to better predictions of solar eruptions that can affect communications and power lines on Earth. More...Watch: First 3-D Images Of The Sun
• MTV Shows Car Owners How To Go Green• Man Gets 5,000 Calls After YouTube Post• The Legacy Of "Silent Spring"
                     					| Watch• More StoriesBusinessToyota Is World's #1 Automaker
Toyota Motor Corp. became the world's top auto seller in the first three months of the year, passing rival General Motors
                        Corp. for the first time ever.  Will it be able to sustain the surge throughout the rest of 2007? More...
• Betting On The Next "Big Thing"• CBS Radio Suspends 2 For Racial Prank• Medicare Trust Fund To Last A Year Longer• More StoriesEntertainmentRethinking Rap
Hip-hop may be the culture and soundtrack to a generation, but it's getting more criticism for its vulgarity and profanity.
                        Bill Whitaker reports. More...Watch: Rap Lyrics Under Scrutiny
• Sneak Peek: Last Smith Role A Self-Parody
                     					| Watch• Letterman To Appear On Regis' Talk Show• CBS Radio Suspends 2 For Racial Prank• More StoriesOpinionPoll: Little Change In Views On Handguns
Last week's shooting rampage at Virginia Tech did little to change Americans' views on gun control, according to a CBS
                        News/N.Y. Times poll. A majority continues to favor stricter handgun laws, but oppose a ban on all handguns. More...Watch: Virginia Tech and Gun Control
• Troops In Iraq Plead For Support 
                     					| Watch• French Lessons
                     					| Watch• Andy Loves His Books• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: Colin Cowie: Wedding In A Week
Lisa Mayo and Stephen Wilfong plan, and have, one with the help of Early Show events planner extraordinaire
                        Colin Cowie, in a special series culminating with their nuptials. Get daily updates here. More...Watch: Wedding In A Week: The Rings
• SciTech: NASA Captures 3D Images Of Sun
                     					| Watch• CBS Evening News: Rethinking Rap
                     					| Watch• U.S.: DNA Tests Exonerate Illinois Man

First 3-D Images Of The SunTwin stereo satellites recently took the first 3-D images of the sun. NASA scientists hope to use the date to forecast the
                                    sun's weather. Jerry Bowen reports from Los Angeles.
